intro: Raphanus campestris, commonly known as field radish, is an annual herbaceous plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its upright growth habit, with a taproot that becomes swollen and edible. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring pinnately lobed leaves and small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its fruits are cylindrical siliques that contain numerous seeds. This plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia but is now cultivated worldwide for its nutritious and flavorful root.
